title: Soap stars who now work normal jobs - from Katie Jarvis to Jeremy Edwards

We recently discovered that Katie Jarvis, who played Hayley Slater in EastEnders, has quit acting to work a very normal job.

She works as a security guard in Romford's B&M store, and said: “I’ve taken a step back from acting.

"I’ve got a job and I'm looking after my kids.”

But which other former soap actors have decided to shun fame and go back to ordinary 9-5 jobs?

Let's take a look.

Gemma Merna

(Image: Austin/Splash News)

Gemma, 35, played glamorous McQueen sister Carmen on Hollyoaks from 2006-2014.

In 2007, she won Best Comedy Performance in 2007 at the British Soap Awards.

At the 2007 National Television Awards she was nominated for "Best Female Soap Actress".

(Image: PA)

But Gemma decided to quit acting and now works as a yoga instructor and personal trainer.

Her Instagram is full of snaps of her in bendy poses and she looks like she's really found her passion.

Kevin Kennedy

(Image: ITV)

Kevin 58, played Norman 'Curly' Watts on Coronation Street for 20 years.

He released a single in 2000 and went on to star in West End Musicals.

Kevin himself once struggled with alcoholism, and now has taken a step back from performing and works alongside his wife on a social enterprise that helps people recover from addictions.

Jeremy Edwards

(Image: Channel 4)

Jeremy played Kurt Benson in Hollyoaks from 1995 to1999, and then went on to play Danny Shaughnessy in Holby City.

In 2005 he placed fourth on Celebrity Big Brother, and he competed in Dancing On Ice in 2009.

He made a brief appearance back on our screens on X Factor: Celebrity, and worked on CCBC series Millie Inbetween until last year.

But in between acting jobs he has found work as a gardener and also worked as a security guard.

(Image: Ian Whittaker)

He has been open about the difficulty for soap actors to find consistent work in between acting jobs.

"I don’t know any actors who work consistently without other work," he said.

"A lucky few, but not many, I had a good ten-year run!"

Adele Silva

(Image: WireImage)

Emmerdale actress Adele played Kelly Windsor on the show from 1993-2011.

She also made a short appearance in Hollyoaks, where she played Angela Brown.

Adele quit soaps and decided to move to to Hollywood to pursue an acting career across the pond.

But in 2017, she was spotted working as a shop assistant in clothing store Ted Baker.

Sean Wilson

(Image: Unknown)

Sean starred in Coronation Street from 1985-2005, playing Martin Platt.

He also had roles on Casualty and Waterloo Road.

But Sean gave up acting to focus on his real passion: cheese.

The 54-year old became a cheese-maker, and set up a cheese-making business, Saddleworth Cheese Company.

Sean's Wikipedia page contains the hilarious entry: "Sean's interest in cheese developed from an early age, and by the age of 13 he simply couldn't get enough of the stuff.

"He attributes much of his interest to his uncles, Gordon Zola, and Phil O'Delphia."

Peter Dean

Peter played Peter Beale in Eastenders and Jeff Bateman in Coronation Street.

Now a practising Buddhist, Peter has been paying the bills with a job as a security guard and at a furniture yard.

But he briefly returned to acting last year when he starred in BBC series The Real Marigold Hotel.

Tom Watt

(Image: PA)

Tom played original cast member Lofty Holloway in EastEnders until 1988, returning briefly in 2019 to attend the funeral of character Harold Legg.

But when Tom's acting work dried up he went into sports journalism, writing for The Observer for several years, and then writing nine books about football.

He also works as an advisory board member for BounceBack, a charity that trains ex-cons.
description: A round-up of the soap actors who quit acting for jobs out of the spotlight after Katie Jarvis gave up fame to work in a DIY store
